overview:
Scott Irwin joined El Dorado Ventures in 2000. He focuses on software, infrastructure and emerging technology investments. At El Dorado, he has been actively involved with prior EDV investments including MediaQ (acquired by nVidia) and Torrex (acquired by Applied Materials).

Prior to El Dorado, Scott held software engineering and product management positions with Accenture, where he managed enterprise software products targeting the energy industry. His early career experience was with the communications systems division of Rockwell International, later acquired by Alcatel.

Scott received a Bachelor’s degree in Systems Engineering from the University of Virginia and an MBA from the UCLA Anderson School of Management, where he was a Venture Fellow and Welsh Scholar.
